Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TrackerVienna_VA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on "antique row" in Hong Kong's Middle Levels area. The rooms are small, the bathroom is in a corner of the room, not really separated, and furnishings show signs of wear. But it's a place to sleep in a good location and if you're not looking for luxury, it's just fine. The staff is very helpful.The Hollywood Road Park next door (with waterfalls, fish ponds and pagodas) is totally charming, and the temple two blocks away is an interesting place to visit.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maria Z
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are spending part of our honeymoon in HK, we had asked for a room on a high floor and when we checked in they were nice enough to upgrade us to the executive floor. They even brought us a bottle of wine, which was very sweet of them. Location is great, we have had breakfast at "classified" which seems to be popular to americans living in HK. I think the only things we disliked is how small the rooms are and that the bathroom and shower have glass doors which really doesn't give you any privacy or keep the "smell" in for that matter. Other than that we would definately recommend this hotel, and would probably come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: belladanesa
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the staff , friendly and available. The room was clean and the view was nice... We will stay there again . I liked the neighborhood and it was close to the train station. Our first trip to Hong Kong . If you are on a budget , I don't think you can do better than this Hotel for the money...

Reviews.Title: “Need some refurbishing, but has potential.”
Reviews.Author: BoywonderTo
Reviews.Content: This property previously operated by the LKF hotel group as the Central Park Hotel. I was somewhat anxious as some of the reviews for Central Park were pretty damning, while some were pretty glowing. I got a good “grand opening” rate so I decided to chance it. From my experience, both the damning and the glowing reviews were accurate. The professional photos provided by hotel management are accurate portrayal of the ambiance of the hotel, except for the wear and tear from a few years of operation. Room: I was given room 1101, a “cityview” room (i.e. a room with view to concrete buildings across the street). Like most hotels in Hong Kong (except the 4* 5* ones) the room was expectedly small, but the space-use was pretty efficient. The lighting was pretty good, and the design quite pleasant and trendy. My room was not mouldy as many others have noted. The carpet was a little stained, but not overly noticeable. The furniture were pretty worn-out and cheap quality though. The air-conditioning in the room was finicky and inconsistent (compare to the consistently cool hallway). The wifi worked super fast, which was a plus. The bathroom was clean and modern overall, thought there was a little bit of moulding as reported by others. Service: While the attitude of the front desk staff was impeccable on the surface, my stay presented a substantive issue which tested true customer service, and on that front they failed. My flight was Newark was cancelled so I arrived 18 hours late. I emailed them while in Newark, still well before noon in HK time, and tell them I need to change my booking as I would not make it for the first night. They charged me for the first night nonetheless even though I did not use the room. This is the kind of situation where any sensible manager who cares about repeated business would use their discretion to waive, or at least discount, the fee for the unused night. The housekeeping staff were accommodating and helpful. No complaint there. Location: The hotel is located at the edge of the busy Soho area. Thus it is fairly central and easily walk-able from fancy restaurants, trendy bars, hip nightclubs and shopping. You can however also experience some of the most traditional/typical residential neighbourhood by simply walking around Western. It is a fairly safe neighbourhood, with no concerns about walking around even late at night. The only downside is that the closest subway or street car stops is still a small hike (approx 7 minutes) away. So overall, it was an okay stay. Nothing extraordinary, but acceptable. The hotel has some potential, if the owner is willing to invest some money and refurbish the room and turn it into a nice boutique hotel. Until then, it would only be a worthwhile stay if you can get a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good location, does most things just about well enough”
Reviews.Author: John_from_NM
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap hotel in a good location in an expensive city. For that alone it is worth looking at. The room is (just) large enough for two, the facilities meet the bare essentials for a city hotel, and although there is no dining facility, there are acceptable places very close by and a 400 metre walk takes you to some very good places. Plus points: very helpful staff, good shower, good air-con in public areas, free wi-fi, free PC access in lobby, in-room safe. Minus points: poor sleep quality (foam pillows), poor air-con in room, cleaning staff unable to time visit (ended up not doing our room once in three days because they were never able to time it for our time out of the room). Would not stay there again unless money dictated the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: memita13
Reviews.Content: When looking into hotels i was concerned about cost in Hong kong. Most hotels were well into the hundreds. i was fortunate to find butterfly on hollywood at a reasonable price and right in Central. I believe location makes a difference and this is exactly what this hotel offers. It is a walk to the subway station, the man mo temple a must see and also walk to wyndham street for bar hopping. The staff speak english and were very friendly and helpful through out my stay. They also have two computers on the lobby for free, that was helpful to check quick email. The things I did not like about the hotel were the big cockroach that I found in my bathroom one night I came back late at night. I didn't like getting woken up early to housekeeping knocking on my neighbors doors. The walls seem to be too thin. I didn't like having one english speaking channel on TV. Also, I didn't like the restaurant map that I was given didn't offer much. It should be updated. Despite all this I would stay at butterfly on hollywood again. Like I said its a great location and great price. The area is also very safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to explore the 'real' Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Penfold555
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find a hotel in the area we wanted, at a price we could afford. We found this place on Wotif.com and booked an 'executive' room. Whilst I wouldn't put any kind of executive in it, it was perfect for our needs and represented value. The rooms are small and the bathroom is a frosted glass capsule inside it (not for the bashful). They were clean and comfortable. The air con was excellent and essential. It will only operate when you are in the room. When you go into your room at first, it can be like an oven. The broadband was quick and reliable. Beds were super comfy. The service at the hotel was excellent. They seemed to predict all your needs in advance. Bags were stored and taxis called before we even asked. The view was great, over a rare park. You stepped out on to Hollywood Rd, a fascinating area we felt extremely safe in. There are western restaurants close (Macca's and Pacific Coffee company) when the local food just won't do it anymore. And tonnes of local places. Our favourite being Lin Heung Teahouse, 160-164 Wellington St. There was also a place up Hollywood Rd called Hollywood Tea selling tea pots and tea, which made a wonderful souvenir. You could spend days exploring this area and going further in the evenings when it is cooler. Don't miss a trip to the smokey temple down the road. To get to the hotel take the airport express train to central ($160HKD for the two of us). Then ask a taxi to take you to Hollywood. You may have to ask 6 or more. They generally did not want to go on the shortish journey (still much to far to walk with suitcases). The trip will cost around $32 HKD.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service in the heart of Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: dmc1989
Reviews.Content: In its price range, Butterfly on Hollywood is the best hotel I’ve stayed in whilst in Hong Kong. The hotel is newly opened and well decorated. The reception staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. I arrived 3 hours before check in and the staff were friendly enough to offer me another room so I could check in immediately. My room overlooked the garden - it’s an ok view for a Hong Kong city centre hotel but don’t feel the need to upgrade to it. The rooms are well appointed, clean, modern and by Hong Kong standards, a good size. The room is equipped with all toiletries you could need and big, white, fluffy towels. There is a safe, large wardrobe, refrigerator and water bottles, a kettle, tea and coffee etc. The beds are extremely comfortable and I had 3 fantastic nights sleep. The TV has two English channels, but the room also has an Ipod docking station and a DVD should you be caught up in the room during a rainstorm. There is free wifi which is a great speed and for those without a computer/smart phone they have Macs in the foyer. The hotel offers various services including wireless printing, a shuttle bus for the airport and laundry. The location is perfect. Surrounded by restaurants, next to a park, 5 minutes walk from SoHo and the metro system. There is a Wellcome supermarket right on the corner if you want to buy snacks to fill up your fridge. I really enjoyed my stay here and will without hesitation book in to one of the Butterfly hotels on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “I hope that I was lied to or I misunderstood, and this is not their upgraded room.”
Reviews.Author: Jasher0
Reviews.Content: When I arrived late in the evening I was a bit surprised to find a small check in desk with stairs up to the lift. The front desk staff was very pleasant and prepared, even with my late arrival. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor.com I asked if I could please be given a room on a higher floor. I was stunned to hear that I had been given a room on the 1st floor; however I was told “We’ve actually upgraded you to one of our premium rooms…” I don’t remember every word she said but I got the impression that this was a recently remodelled upgraded room, which is what I believe I heard. Having previously read that they were remodelling, I thought that the first floor would be as good as any place to start. They did assure me the room would be quiet. I proceeded to carry my bag up the short stairs to the lifts and on up the 1st floor (UG, then 1) I was immediately leery of this supposed remodel. The hallways are very narrow, dark, the carpet and walls also appear dirty. I approached my room to see a patched up door, not very indicative of a remodel as usually the whole floor is remodelled and not just the interior of the rooms. Upon entering my room I was greeted with a very dark, empty room with a kitchenette, a large flat panel TV on the wall, a small bed, and a window ledge turned into some kind of desk. There was no dresser or any freestanding furniture beside the bed and a single stationary chair at the desk, there were built in drawers into the ‘Desk”. The carpet had stains, the desk/ledge had water stains, the windows were pretty dirty, and the blinds were not able to easily go down all the way as they would hit the phone or the iPod clock. The shower uses a motel type flimsy curtain that billowed in while showering and allowed water to spray into the rest of the bathroom. Oh and back to the bed, it was very small, I am about 5’8” and my feet were at, almost off the edge of the bed!? Reviewing the website and previous reviews I became convinced that I was not in a remodelled room and higher floors would have the best rooms. I decided to take the lift and randomly look at floors above. Between my exploring and stopping on other floors to pick up passengers I saw four different floors. Looking out of the lift I saw the same dirty carpets and walls. I also did discover a large trash bag in my lift lobby and an odd curtain with objects protruding. After a quick check behind the curtain, I discovered that the last meter or so of hallway was actually the maid closet using a curtain, this same curtain I saw on all floors I stopped on. My last night there, the bar across the street was really going strong and from my room I could hear every note of the music. I was able to fall asleep only to wake up at 5 something to sounds of heavy machinery outside. Looking at the website, and seeing signs in the lobby I have high hopes for their eventual remodel, however it is not there yet. The remodel will take time and I have not seen any signs of construction beginning. Based on my experience, misunderstandings aside, I could not recommend this hotel except for a good price if available.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: hsjhaveri
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and overall an average experience. The rooms are small and the location is far away from the mtr station.It is situated in sheung wan area(the old hongkong city) the airconditing is not good at all.the bathrooms are very small.Would not stay again at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A gem on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: Globalhoneymooner
Reviews.Content: Fresh, clean, vibrant modern hotel. I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on here but this was cheap so we booked it! Was so delighted when we walked into a beautiful, clean, modern room. It was spotless and had a vibrant, funky feel about it. We were on the 20th floor as we asked for a non smoking room. Very quiet at night also. The staff were extremely helpful, anything you asked they would do with a smile. Even as we were leaving they couldn't have been more helpful with carrying bags and flagging a taxi on the street. All in all a great hotel. Location is in walking distance of the main areas like Connaught Rd, Central and Star Ferry. The area Soho is also very near and has loads of bars & restaurants (although this is an expensive area).

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly - it's all about service!”
Reviews.Author: StarEAM
Reviews.Content: I'm travelling HK a lot these past 2 years and have quite a lot of experience living in 5 stars, 4 stars hotels and even little guesthouse in kowloon. HK is expensive and rooms are usually not as spacious as you would stay in china or thailand, thus for me, the service counts a lot when I consider which hotel I should choose for my next trip here. Talking about service, I would definitely recommend Butterfly in HK. Been to other two Butterfly hotels on prat and on morrison earlier this year, I was totally impressed by the service of the staff here - though young, but absolutely friendly and professional. Butterfly on Hollywood has definitely matched the service quality of those 2 I tried this year. Not like even some big hotel brands whose staffs always have a look of waiting for their day offs and not eager to help, the smiles of Butterfly staffs here in Hollywood are always cheerful, and my big thumb up for their positive attitude on solving my little troubles everyday. Rather than treating me like a customer they are more treating me like a new friend in their house, which is pretty enjoyable. Location wise this Butterfly is a very good spot for my business too, heading to different office building in Central just spent me moment of a few blinks.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will bring down the image of Butterfly!”
Reviews.Author: JJP612
Reviews.Content: I was always satisfied with the Butterfly on Morrison, this time I chose the one on Hollywood for location reasons. But I was very disappointed by the room conditions. Dirty carpet, moldy shower, smelly. However, the staff was very friendly and gave me a better room on floor 23 since the one on 7th was too dark and dirty! It was told to me, Butterfly just took over an existing hotel (Central Park Hotel) but they didn't refurbished everything. Next time I'll go back to Morrison....

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood near Soho in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: carolannt
Reviews.Content: This was my third Butterfly hotel in Hong Kong in 3 weeks. I must say I've been very lucky to start with the one on Wellington, that was definitely the best at all levels. At first, when I walked in my room at Butterfly on Hollywood Road, I've felt very disappointed, almost shocked by the difference with the others. I returned to the front desk to ask if they didn't have something less depressing. The carpet didn't seem to be clean, it was all grey and brown and so small compared to the other rooms I had previously. The staff has been very nice, they explained to me that this hotel was actually the oldest one and it would be renovated in a few weeks.Then they made me choose between 3 rooms and I picked the biggest with a nice view.It was very quiet and I had a good sleep there, also appreciated the great location. I like to go to Life for lunch or dinner and it's near by. Just across the street, there is a nice restaurant and bar, in the end I thought the hotel was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but cheap..”
Reviews.Author: Keentravell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is currently being refurbished however when we arrived we were really surprised that the room was so dirty. The carpet was stained and smelled bad. The bathroom was moulding everywhere. Housekeeping were ok, but very poor with replacing tissues and paper and amenities. The only good thing was that at least we had free Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JosephHK
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights in Jun. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. It just feels really nice – the aircon works well, the room was very clean and beautifully designed. Good attention to detail – down to the scent in reception – very nice. Service was efficient and friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Butterfly on Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: No.263 Hollywood Road, Central, Hong Kong 000, China
